```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = TRUE)
library(dplyr)
library(readr)
library(skimr)
library(printr)
library(ggplot2)
library(tidyr)
library(gridExtra)
```

## Solubility Data

Here, I load the solubility data and select the predictors (`Molecular.Weight`, `Number.of.Rotatable.Bonds`, `Polar.Surface.Area`) and the label (`solubility.above.or.below.median`). Change the label into a factor with two levels, 1 and 0, meaning above or below the median solubility respectively:
``` {r message = FALSE, include = FALSE}
binarySolubility <- read_csv("data/delaney-binary.csv")
train <- binarySolubility %>%
  select(Molecular.Weight, 
         Number.of.Rotatable.Bonds, 
         Polar.Surface.Area,
         solubility.above.or.below.median) %>%
  mutate_at(.vars = "solubility.above.or.below.median", .funs = factor)
```

### Summary

``` {r echo = FALSE}
summary(train)
```

### Distributions

``` {r, fig.height = 2, fig.width = 10, echo = FALSE}
p1 <- ggplot(train, aes(x = Molecular.Weight)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 10) +
  ylim(0, 600) +
  ggtitle("Molecular Weight") +
  xlab("g/mol")

p2 <- ggplot(train, aes(x = Number.of.Rotatable.Bonds)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 10) +
  ylim(0, 600) +
  ggtitle("Number of Rotatable Bonds") +
  xlab("bonds")

p3 <- ggplot(train, aes(x = Polar.Surface.Area)) +
  geom_histogram(bins = 10) +
  ylim(0, 600) +
  ggtitle("Polar Surface Area") +
  xlab("sq. angstroms")

grid.arrange(p1, p2, p3, nrow = 1)
```
